title: How to Transfer Google Contacts to Your iPhone: Easy Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . This looks like a grey box with gears on it. [1] X Research source You can import your Gmail contacts by adding your Gmail account to the Mail app. You can also choose to sync your mail, calendar, and more. Use this method if you haven't yet added your Gmail account to your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you have an older version of iOS, you can skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You may need to scroll down to find this. It's next to an icon of a white envelope with a blue background.

steps.title: Tap Mail Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Mail Accounts . This is near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Add Account.
steps.content: Tap Add Account . If you have any other emails linked to the Mail app, you'll see them listed under the Accounts header.

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . This is in the middle of the page. Google's Sign In page will open within the app.

steps.title: Enter your Gmail email address and tap Next.
steps.content: Enter your Gmail email address and tap Next . In the text field that appears, type in the email address for your Gmail account.

steps.title: Enter your Gmail account password and tap Next.
steps.content: Enter your Gmail account password and tap Next . Type in the password you use to log into Gmail. You can check the Show password box to toggle the password's visibility. If you have two-factor authentication turned on, you'll need to follow the on-screen instructions to verify your device. If you forgot your password, you'll need to reset it .

steps.title: Toggle on "Contacts".
steps.content: Toggle on "Contacts". The switch will turn green. This ensures your Gmail contacts will be imported to your iPhone. By default, Mail will also be toggled on. If you only want to import your Gmail contacts and not your email or anything else, toggle off the other options. Otherwise, tap it to sync it with your contacts.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so will save your changes and add the Gmail account to your iPhone's Mail app. You can now find your Gmail contacts in the Contacts app . If you don't see your contacts, you can try troubleshooting your device .

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . Tap the Settings app icon, which resembles a grey box with gears on it. [2] X Research source Use this method if you already have your Gmail account synced to your Mail app but need to sync your contacts.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you have an older version of iOS, you can skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . You may need to scroll down to find this. It's next to an icon of a white envelope with a blue background.

steps.title: Tap Mail Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Mail Accounts . This is near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap your Gmail account.
steps.content: Tap your Gmail account. You should see it listed underneath the Accounts header.

steps.title: Toggle on "Contacts" .
steps.content: Toggle on "Contacts" . The switch will turn green, signifying that the selected Gmail account's contacts are being added to your iPhone's Contacts app. [3] X Research source If this switch is already green, your Gmail contacts are enabled on your iPhone.

steps.title: If your contacts aren't syncing, you may need to enable SSL.
steps.content: If your contacts aren't syncing, you may need to enable SSL. Follow these steps to set up a secure connection to sync your contacts to your iPhone: [4] X Research source Open the Settings app on your iPhone. Tap Contacts . Tap Accounts . Select the Google account with the contacts you want to import. Turn on the "Contacts" switch if disabled. Select Account and then Advanced . Tap the "Use SSL" switch to turn on SSL. Tap Account and select Done . Re-add your Gmail account.

steps.title: Why can't I see my contacts?
steps.content: Why can't I see my contacts? If you can't see your contacts, you may need to resync your account. Navigate to your Mail account settings, and tap Delete Account below the sync options. Then, add it again. Alternatively, it's possible Google blocked your device from accessing your contacts. Log in to your Gmail account on your computer or usual device. You might need to acknowledge an "Unusual sign-in location" prompt before you can continue importing.

steps.title: Can I export contacts from my iPhone?
steps.content: Can I export contacts from my iPhone? You can export existing contacts on your phone by doing the following: Open the Contacts app. Tap the back arrow to see your Lists . Tap and hold the list you want to export. Tap Export . Set your export options. Select where to export.

steps.title: How do you import Gmail contacts to iCloud?
steps.content: How do you import Gmail contacts to iCloud? When you add your Gmail account to your iPhone, your contacts will sync to your iPhone. To make sure your contacts are also stored in iCloud, you will need to enable syncing for the Contacts app in Settings > your name > iCloud > See all .
